profile_data.headline: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

experience.description: ● Developing an SQL co-pilot (text-to-SQL) chatbot by curating a custom SQL dataset, automating manual SQL tasks in Python, implementing entity extraction and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques.
experience.title: AI Developer

experience.description:
● Engaged in engineering a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system using large language models (LLMs) to perform semantic analysis of application resumes, accurately extracting and summarizing key achievements of applicants with the ECE department at NCSU.
● Executing extensive data preprocessing and annotation pipelines, leveraging natural language processing techniques to prepare training datasets. Fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs to specialize in educational document analysis.
experience.title: Natural Language Processing Engineer

experience.description:
◦ Developed and integrated biomedical signal processing pipeline for cuff-less blood pressure estimation using ECG signals. Implemented filtering, segmentation, hand-crafted feature extraction, data augmentation on biomedical signals.
◦ Developed Deep Learning algorithms using LSTMs and Transformer technologies to automate blood pressure estimation for deployment on mobile edge-devices to facilitate real-time prediction on low powered edge-devices.
◦ Recipient of the Graduate Student Support Plan (GSSP), a highly competitive support package providing standard tuition coverage for one semester, in recognition of academic excellence
experience.title: Deep Learning Engineer - Graduate Research Assistant

experience.description:
◦ Conducted data extraction from various sources, performing comprehensive cleaning, transformation, and aggregation of customer and sales data for savories and snacks to ensure high-quality datasets for developing analytics models.
◦ Implemented a clustering-based approach using DBSCAN to decompose the customer behavior prediction task, developing tailored models for each cluster that improved prediction accuracy and processing speed for large datasets.
◦ Developed and optimized a COWRF (COA-optimized Weighted Random Forest) model, achieving a 39.17% increase in processing speed and a 97.2% accuracy rate, marking a 4.7% improvement over previous models to evaluate the impact of promotional activities for snacks and savories, enhancing marketing strategy effectiveness for the products.
experience.title: Data Science Intern - Predictive Analytics

experience.description:
◦ Developed and deployed a neonatal seizure detection system utilizing a scalable machine learning architecture based on ProtoNN, achieving high sensitivity and compact model deployment optimized for ultra-edge devices.
◦ Achieved a sensitivity of 87% and inference time of 243.92 milliseconds with a model size as small as 4.84 KB, ensuring rapid and accurate seizure detection on resource-constrained devices.
◦ Presented the research outcomes titled ”Scalable Machine Learning Architecture for Neonatal Seizure Detection on Ultra-Edge Devices” at the Second International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Signal Processing (AISP 2022), in collaboration with IEEE.
experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer - Undergraduate Research Assistant

publications.name: Global maximum power point tracking of PV systems using Gray wolf optimization technique
publications.publisher: Third International Conference on Power and Embedded Drive Control (ICPEDC 2021)
publications.description: Modeled a solar photovoltaic system integrated with a DC-DC boost converter with a novel global maximum power point tracking (MPPT) algorithm - Gray Wolf Optimizer (GWO) - for different irradiation. GWO was able to capture the global maximum power point under all conditions of irradiation (including partial shading) compared to conventional MPPT algorithms

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

publications.name: Scalable Machine Learning Architecture for Neonatal Seizure Detection on Ultra-Edge Devices
publications.publisher: Second International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Signal Processing (AISP 2022 in association with IEEE)
publications.description:
Leveraged ProtoNN ML classifier to classify EEG signals into ictal or normal activity. Achieved low
182ms detection latency with a 4.8kB model and a sensitivity of 87% making this suitable for low-power wearable devices.

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer
AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Built and deployed a production-ready AWS chatbot using SageMaker JumpStart to answer order status to
customers, using the Flan-UL2 LLM Model.
- Improved the accuracy and fluency of the generated text using RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation).
projects.title: AWS Chatbot

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Employed transfer learning by updating the popular ResNet18 pre-trained model to predict the emotion conveyed
from audio files.
- Audio signal processing along with data augmentation was performed on the raw .wav files and relevant features
were extracted. The model exhibited a test accuracy of 93.84%.
projects.title: Emotion Detection from Audio

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description: Optimized detection and classification of solar panel faults using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) on Infrared Solar Module dataset. A 11 layered CNN model was implemented on image data to yield better predictive performance (a training accuracy of 90%) than the existing state-of-the-art model implemented on the same dataset. An interactive web application developed with Flask Framework in Python was used to render the results.
projects.title: Fault Detection in solar panels using Image Data and CNN

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description: Using the European Soccer Dataset from Kaggle, a few questions were statistically analyzed, namely - Does the traditional belief in the existence of an underlying advantage for European soccer teams playing at home have statistical significance? What formation has a better overall rate of victory, the 4–4–2 or the 4–3–3?
projects.title: Hpothesis testing

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description: Pyramid blending refers to seamlessly blending an area/region from a source(foreground) image into a target (background) image. This project develops functions to implement Gaussian/Laplacian pyramid.
projects.title: Image Blending

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description: Developed an open-source Python Package Index Distribution that extracts features from raw EEG/ECG signals. It utilizes simple packages such as numba, scipy, scikit-learn, nolds etc., and extracts time-domain, entropy-domain and geometrical features from EEG and ECG signals. Contributed in creating the tool that extracts features from EEG signals.
projects.title: PySigPro

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Developed a matrix factorization model for movie recommender systems in PySpark. The model achieved an RMSE of 0.85 on the MovieLens 100K dataset.
- Implemented a distributed ALS algorithm for matrix factorization in PySpark. The algorithm was able to scale to large datasets and achieve good performance, with a hitrate of 80% on the MovieLens 1M dataset.
projects.title: PySpark Recommendation System

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Developed a real-time stress monitoring system for drivers using VGGNet architecture, that classifies ECG signals
collected real-time from a sensor. The signal processing, feature extraction, training and testing of the VGGNet
architecture were personally carried out by me, resulting in an 82.45% training accuracy achievement.
- Implemented a system that integrates a real-time ECG sensor with a Jetson Nano for inference using the trained
VGGNet architecture with the results being conveyed through a user-friendly Flask application in real-time.
projects.title: Real-time Stress Classification

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Developed and deployed a neonatal seizure detection system utilizing a scalable machine learning architecture based on ProtoNN, achieving high sensitivity and compact model deployment optimized for ultra-edge devices. 
- Achieved a sensitivity of 87% and inference time of 243.92 milliseconds with a model size as small as 4.84 KB, ensuring rapid and accurate seizure detection on resource-constrained devices.
- Presented the research outcomes titled “Scalable Machine Learning Architecture for Neonatal Seizure Detection on Ultra-Edge Devices” at the Second International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Signal Processing (AISP 2022), in collaboration with IEEE.
projects.title: Scalable Machine Learning Architecture for Neonatal Seizure Detection on Ultra-Edge Devices

member.occupation: AI (NLP) Developer @ UBS | Seeking Full-time roles as NLP/ML Engineer

projects.description:
- Developed a self-supervised SimCLR model using PyTorch Lightning, employing a ResNet-18 encoder and a two-layer MLP projection head.
Implemented advanced data augmentation and adjusted color jitter parameters to enhance training stability and speed on the STL10 dataset.
- Achieved a 92.06% test accuracy by optimizing with cosine annealing, SGD, and InfoNCE loss. Implemented Logistic Regression on feature representations learned from SimCLR on the CIFAR10 dataset to demonstrate robust transferability of learned representations, with a 81% accuracy.
projects.title: Self-supervised Image Classification
